situation.title: Possibilities and obligations of foreigners when entering the CZ
situation.meta_description: Rules and recommendations for entering the territory of the Czech Republic.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

 From 30 January 2021 onwards, for foreigners is not allowed to come to the Czech Republic for reasons other than necessary.   

Necessary reasons include a trip to work and to do business, a profession, a trip back to their places of residence, a necessary trip to family or close relatives, a trip to leave the Czech Republic, participation in a wedding or funeral, participation in education, including internships and exams. More informations can be found at current measures

Foreigners are therefore not allowed to travel to the Czech Republic for the purpose of tourism and recreation.

If a foreigner within an EU country travels in the Czech Republic for one of the above reasons, is obliged to determine its responsibilities according to whether or not the country in which he has resided for more than 12 hours in the last 14 days is on the list of countries with a low risk of infection. If he does not find the country on this list, he can enter the territory of the Czech Republic with the condition of filling in the arrival form and with the condition of undergo the PCR test. It is necessary to undergo the PCR test at your own expense within 5 days prior to the arrival in the Czech Republic and submit the result to the relevant regional hygienic station within 7 days. Exceptions to this obligation can be found in the current measure. If the foreigner is an EU citizen, he / she can replace PCR testing in the Czech Republic by submitting a negative PCR test result, which was performed in an EU country and is not older than 72 hours. Until a negative PCR test result is submitted, foreigners are prohibited from moving freely apart from this exceptions.

Foreigners from countries outside the EU who are not on the list of countries with a low risk of infection are not allowed to travel to the Czech Republic. There are exceptions to this ban, which you will find in the current measure.

The exact conditions for entry into the territory of the Czech Republic, including exceptions, can be found clearly in the table of the Ministry of the Interior of the Czech Republic and on the english version of the website of the Ministry of the Interior of the Czech Republic.

We also recommend you to check the conditions of accommodation.

In case of doubts or questions, please call the Ministry of the Interior of the Czech Republic: +420 974 820 680 - option 3 (Mon - Thu: 8:00 - 16:00 and Fri: 8:00 - 12:00). Or by e-mail: cestovani.covid19@mvcr.cz. Information is available in Czech and English language.
